wikipedia_page.main: John Le Fleming (23 October 1865 – 7 October 1942), also known as Jack Le Fleming, was an English sportsman who played rugby union for England and first-class cricket for Kent County Cricket Club. He played rugby for Blackheath F.C. and Cambridge University R.U.F.C. and was a good all-round athlete, competing in athletics and figure skating. He was an Army tutor at Tonbridge School and served in the British Army during World War I.

response: *John Le Fleming (1865–1942), English cricketer and rugby union player

response: Le Fleming's oldest brother John also played for Kent, making a total of 40 appearances for the county First XI between 1889 and 1899.John Le Fleming, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-04-22. Despite their careers overlapping, the brothers never played in the same Kent side.
